guideBot.title: Your Srenova Guide
guideBot.initialMessage: Your viager application is coming along well. Adding professional contacts like a solicitor and financial adviser can significantly strengthen your application and provide valuable support throughout the process.

suggestedQuestions.requiredDocuments: What documents will I need for the next step?
suggestedQuestions.processTimeline: How long does the viager process typically take?
suggestedQuestions.postSubmission: What happens after I submit my application?

responses.required_documents: For the next step, you'll need: 1) Proof of ID (passport/driving licence), 2) Recent utility bills, 3) Property documentation (deeds, mortgage statements), 4) Financial statements. We'll provide a detailed checklist once you're ready to proceed.
responses.process_timeline: The typical viager process takes 8-12 weeks from application to completion. This includes property valuation, legal checks, and finalising agreements. We'll keep you informed at every stage and work to expedite where possible.
responses.post_submission: After submission, our team will review your application within 48 hours. We'll then arrange a property valuation and connect you with our legal team. You'll receive regular updates via email and through your dedicated adviser.

contemplationPhase.title: Contemplation Phase
contemplationPhase.description: This is a significant life decision. We recommend taking time to contemplate all aspects before proceeding to the next stages.
contemplationPhase.remember: Remember: Take at least 24 hours to consider all implications before proceeding. You may want to discuss with your support network and trusted advisors.

nonBindingDisclaimer.title: Important
nonBindingDisclaimer.text: This application is non-binding until you accept an offer at a later stage in this process. You are free to withdraw at any time before accepting a formal offer without any obligation.
